summary: Do you get that feeling where you have a fan theory and it's actually a positive one and you want to share it with everyone but...
body: Do you get that feeling where you have a fan theory and it’s actually a positive one and you want to share it with everyone but at the same time you don’t want to Jinx it but you can’t keep it in as well ? Just like Tom Holland struggles to keep the frog in his mouth.

reblog.comment: Do you get that feeling where you have a fan theory and it’s actually a positive one and you want to share it with everyone but at the same time you don’t want to Jinx it but you can’t keep it in as well ? Just like Tom Holland struggles to keep the frog in his mouth.

trail.content_raw: Do you get that feeling where you have a fan theory and it’s actually a positive one and you want to share it with everyone but at the same time you don’t want to Jinx it but you can’t keep it in as well ? Just like Tom Holland struggles to keep the frog in his mouth.
trail.content: Do you get that feeling where you have a fan theory and it’s actually a positive one and you want to share it with everyone but at the same time you don’t want to Jinx it but you can’t keep it in as well ? Just like Tom Holland struggles to keep the frog in his mouth.

summary: Queen of Shadows (Throne of Glass, #4) by Sarah J. Maas  The queen has returned.  Everyone Celaena Sardothien loves has been...
caption:
Queen of Shadows (Throne of Glass, #4) by Sarah J. Maas 

The queen has returned.

Everyone Celaena Sardothien loves has been taken from her. But she’s at last returned to the empire—for vengeance, to rescue her once-glorious kingdom, and to confront the shadows of her past…

She has embraced her identity as Aelin Galathynius, Queen of Terrasen. But before she can reclaim her throne, she must fight.

She will fight for her cousin, a warrior prepared to die for her. She will fight for her friend, a young man trapped in an unspeakable prison. And she will fight for her people, enslaved to a brutal king and awaiting their lost queen’s triumphant return.

The fourth volume in the New York Times bestselling series continues Celaena’s epic journey and builds to a passionate, agonizing crescendo that might just shatter her world.

This review contains spoilers!

I remember liking this book simply because of how much happens. I also really liked how the story is filled with so much action—-in all of the points of view we read from.

This book review is actually a re-read book review. So this time around my thoughts on Queen of Shadows are, admittedly, a little jumbled.

(Full review on Adele Is Reading)

tags: rhys is the most iconic high lord
summary: Remember that one time in ACOWAR when there was only one throne in the court of nightmares, so Rhys made Feyre sit on the...
body:
Remember that one time in ACOWAR when there was only one throne in the court of nightmares, so Rhys made Feyre sit on the throne, while he sat on the arm of it.

That was one Iconic scene, which will always make me love him. — We need more such iconic male characters in ya lit.

reblog.comment:

summary: Overall: 4.8/5 Stars Characters: 5/5 Setting: 5/5 Writing: 5/5 Plot and Themes: 4/5 Awesomeness Factor: 4.5/5 Review in a...
caption:
Overall: 4.8/5 Stars
Characters: 5/5
Setting: 5/5
Writing: 5/5
Plot and Themes: 4/5
Awesomeness Factor: 4.5/5
Review in a Nutshell: The Assassin’s Blade is a must read for any Throne of Glass fan, giving important insight and fleshing out the fantastic world.

“If you can learn to endure pain, you can survive anything. Some people learn to embrace it- to love it. Some endure it through drowning it in sorrow, or by making themselves forget. Others turn it into anger.” 

Blog || Goodreads || Bookstagram || Twitter  || Reviews

- Premise -
The Assassin’s Blade includes five novellas taking place in the world of Throne of Glass, following everyone’s favorite assassin, Celaena Sardothien, as she goes on five different missions. 

“Life isn’t easy, no matter where you are. You’ll make choices you think are right, and then suffer for them.” 

- Setting -
These novella’s show a part of the setting that isn’t portrayed in the first two Throne of Glass novels. 

“Quiet as mice, quiet as the wind, quiet as the grave.” 

- Writing -
Sarah J. Maas, once again, writes beautifully. Her prose is elegant while also maintaining a fast pace for the epic action scenes, which there are quite a few of in this collection.

“She would tuck Sam into her heart, a bright light for her to take out whenever things were darkest.” 

- Plot-
The plot in each story varies, but they all connect and tell Celaena’s story of what happened leading up to where she was at the beginning of Throne of Glass. Despite knowing how it will end, Sarah J. Maas still keeps the story interesting and throws a few twists. These novella’s lay down the groundwork for a lot of things to happen later in the series, as well as explain a few things that weren’t clear in the first two novels. Some of the novellas are more interesting than others, but none of them are boring, something I don’t see in many novella collections.

“She was fire, she was darkness, she was dust and blood and shadow.” 

- Characters -
There are so many amazing characters introduced in this book! First off- Sam is amazing and I cried so hard while reading. Going into this knowing how it ends still didn’t prepare me for what happens. I should have known better. You get so attached to all of these characters! While the individual stories are short (true novella length), each character is given so much depth and personality. This collection also really adds to Celaena’s character. She was definitely a well rounded and developed character in the first two books alone, but The Assassin’s Blade continues to add layers to her personality and to her history.

“My name is Celaena Sardothien,“ she whispered, "and I will not be afraid.” 

- Conclusion -
Pros- Further explored the fascinating setting, amazing characters
Cons- This book broke my heart.
Overall- 4.8/5 stars.
If you haven’t picked up The Assassin’s Blade you need to do so immediately! This collection of novella’s adds so much to an already fantastic series.
caption_abstract:

Characters: 5/5
Setting: 5/5
Writing: 5/5
Plot and Themes: 4/5
Awesomeness Factor: 4.5/5

summary: I am beyond thrilled that I signed up for the Now in Books subscription box! First, I received a SIGNED copy of Sarah J. Maas’...
body:
I am beyond thrilled that I signed up for the Now in Books subscription box! First, I received a SIGNED copy of Sarah J. Maas’ Catwoman: Soulstealer!

I must say that I adore Maas’ cool author signature!

As an aside, I made it my life’s mission while growing up to perfect my own signature – to make it unique.

Now, I feel as though my signature always varies. I wonder if authors and celebrities in general practice their signatures?

Other than the sweet surprise of a signed – much-anticipated by moi – book, the box includes a playlist inspired by the story, which I think is absolutely genius and amazing!

Although I have a tough time listening to tunes while reading, I’m really looking forward to sampling the playlist – when I’m NOT reading! 😀

I’m so glad I checked out the book without its jacket – so purple and pretty! Plus, I adore the Catwoman figure, which is all that adorns the purple background.

Additionally, I love, love, love the saying on the bookmark included – “When the bat’s away, the cat will play.”!

Overall, I am incredibly pleased with my rookie box! I went wild and subscribed to seemingly 50 bookish boxes! LOL! Therefore, I will have plenty of Unboxed posts coming up! 😀

Love, Maggie

Catting Around I am beyond thrilled that I signed up for the Now in Books subscription box! First, I received a SIGNED copy of Sarah J.

trail.content:
I am beyond thrilled that I signed up for the Now in Books subscription box! First, I received a SIGNED copy of Sarah J. Maas’ Catwoman: Soulstealer!

I must say that I adore Maas’ cool author signature!

As an aside, I made it my life’s mission while growing up to perfect my own signature – to make it unique.

Now, I feel as though my signature always varies. I wonder if authors and celebrities in general practice their signatures?

External image
External image

Other than the sweet surprise of a signed – much-anticipated by moi – book, the box includes a playlist inspired by the story, which I think is absolutely genius and amazing!

External image

Although I have a tough time listening to tunes while reading, I’m really looking forward to sampling the playlist – when I’m NOT reading! 😀

I’m so glad I checked out the book without its jacket – so purple and pretty! Plus, I adore the Catwoman figure, which is all that adorns the purple background.

Additionally, I love, love, love the saying on the bookmark included – “When the bat’s away, the cat will play.”!

External image
External image

Overall, I am incredibly pleased with my rookie box! I went wild and subscribed to seemingly 50 bookish boxes! LOL! Therefore, I will have plenty of Unboxed posts coming up! 😀

Love, Maggie

Owned and managed by Irving Braxiatel himself, the Braxiatel Collection is arguably the finest and most extensive collection in the known universe. 'Collection of what?' is an invalid question. It is a collection of everything.
Greetings, my name is April and this is my little Collection of everything.
My blog has the official approval of Miles Richardson. (15/09/2016).
Previously known as songofgallifrey.
